snippet: The plan includes limiting the deductions and exclusions high-income families can claim, increasing taxes on tobacco products and adopting a new minimum tax on income over $1 million.
abstract: President Obama's budget proposal would cut more than $1.1 trillion from government's projected deficits over next 10 years; plan includes limiting deductions and exclusions high-income families can claim, increasing taxes on tobacco products and adopting new minimum tax on income over $1 million.
lead_paragraph: The plan includes limiting the deductions and exclusions high-income families can claim, increasing taxes on tobacco products and adopting a new minimum tax on income over $1 million.

headline.main: Budget Office Says Obama Plan Would Cut Deficit by $1 Trillion
headline.print_headline: Budget Office Says Obama Plan Would Cut Deficit by $1 Trillion
